text: Geotechnical report confirms rock type, depth, and excavation recommendations
Blasting permits or excavation method approvals obtained from local authorities
Pre-blast condition survey of adjacent structures completed and documented
Blasting plan reviewed and stamped by certified blaster or geotechnical engineer
Blasting mats, warning systems, and exclusion zones in place
Seismic monitoring devices installed at nearest sensitive structure/location
Hydraulic hammer, ripper, or breaker operating at correct pressure/angle
Vibration and noise levels monitored as per equipment specs/local regulations
Blasting conducted only during permitted hours with audible/visual alerts
Seismograph logs (PPV/duration) recorded and reviewed after each blast
Flyrock, overbreak, and ground heave inspected post-blast
Scaling, trimming, or additional mechanical removal completed as required
Rock disposal and haul logs maintained and verified by inspector
Excavation to final line, grade, and slope within specified tolerance

id: • NRCan Blasting Regulations (Canada), CSA Z122, OH&S Part 33 – Blasting
